docs.lead_paragraph: About 8,500 additional patients of a Long Island doctor will be advised to get tested for blood-borne diseases as an inquiry into his practice expands, the state’s Department of Health says. The agency initially told 628 patients of the doctor, Harvey S. Finkelstein, an anesthesiologist with a practice in Plainview, that they might be at risk for hepatitis and H.I.V. Health officials have said he dipped syringes more than once into vials of medicine, contaminating the drugs and infecting at least one person with hepatitis. Dr. Finkelstein says he has changed his technique.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite opposition, a public health advisory panel voted on Monday to require all children in New Jersey who attend preschool or are in day care to get annual flu vaccines.

docs.lead_paragraph: Today we have answers to selected questions and comments prompted by the seventh part of our series on China's environment from Michael P. Walsh, a mechanical engineer who has spent his entire career working on motor vehicle pollution control issues, in the United States and in other countries, including Brazil, Hong Kong, Mexico, Vietnam and China.
